citation.article-title: Saccharothrix: a new genus of the Actinomycetales related to Nocardiopsis.

p.s: Saccharothrix australiensis (aus. tral. i. en' sis. L. adj. australiensis referring to the location of the soil sample from which the organism was first isolated)
Brownish to grayish yellow substrate mycelium with yellowish white to yellowish gray aerial mycelium (particularly on yeast extract-malt extract agar).
Brownish soluble pigment produced on several media.
Casein, tyrosine, gelatin, and esculin hydrolyzed.
Acid produced from cellobiose, dextrin, erythritol, fructose, glucose, glycerol, maltose, mannose, sorbitol, and trehalose.
Nitrate not used as a sole nitrogen source.
Acetate, DL-malate, propionate, pyruvate, and succinate used as sole carbon sources.
The type strain of S. australiensis is strain LL-BM782Ce82 (= ATCC 31947 = NRRL 11239).
